fields.description:
h3. User Story
As a Zapier user, I can create Zaps that run when a request is created or updated using the New Request and Updated Request triggers. I would like the request to include attachment data.

h3. Possible solution(s)
Get attachments with the other issue data.
fields.summary: As a Zapier user, I want to use the attachments from requests that are create and updated in my Zaps

fields.description:
h3. User Story
As a Zapier user, I want to set a Reporter when using the action to create a request in my Zap.

h3. Possible solution(s)
Add a Reporter field to the Create Request action.

It may be helpful to add a separate action to search users to find the ID of the user to set as the Reporter
fields.summary: As a Zapier user, I want to set the reporter when creating a request

fields.description:
h3. User story
As a Zapier user, I want to set the Priority field when using the action to create a request in my Zap.

h3. Possible solutions
Add support for the Priority field to be set in the "Create Request" action in the Jira Service Desk Zapier app.

Currently the only supported fields are:
* String/text
* Single select
* Multi select
* Checkbox
* Radio button

h3. Impact
Currently if a user tries to create a request with a required priority field, the field isn't displayed at all and the request inevitably fails with a 400 Bad Request HTTP response code.
fields.summary: As a Zapier user, I want to set the Priority field when creating a request

fields.description:
h3. User story
As a Zapier user, I want to create Zaps that update my Jira Service Desk requests.

h3. Possible solutions
Add an "Update Request" action to the Jira Service Desk Zapier app where they can select a field to update and a value to set.

This would require a "Find Request" search action to find the right request to update based on data coming into the Zap.

h3. Open questions
What fields are important to update?
fields.summary: As a Zapier user, I want to create Zaps that update my Jira Service Desk requests.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira Service Desk for Zapier app (maintained by the JSD Ecosystem team) polls the Jira issue search API to fetch issues to show Zapier users as samples.

This search also powers the Created Request and Updated Request triggers.

Because we fetch 100 issues at a time, if the issues are larger (and the combined response is > 6MB in size), Zapier fails to process the response.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an account in Zapier
 # Set up a rule with an Updated Request trigger
 # Connect to a Jira site with at least 100 issues with a lot of data (attachments, fields, comments, change history, etc.) . such that the issue search returns > 6MB of data.

h3. Expected Results

The samples are displayed to the user.

h3. Actual Results

The user sees an error that the "body size is too long" and cannot continue to set up the rule with sample data.

Alternatively, if this were to happen when polling issues to trigger a rule the rule would fail to trigger and the user would be alerted by email.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Polling for issues to show sample issues, or perform the Created Request / Updated Request triggers sometimes fails if the issues are large

fields.description:
Currently, while raising an issue via the portal, the media session times out after 15-20 minute period. The ticket can still be submitted fine after that however any attachments upload fails.

The suggestion is to increase this media session timeout period.
fields.summary: Increase the media session timeout period for attachment upload via portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If there are multiple request type groups defined but only a single request type group contains request types, the requests types will be listed directly on the portal outside of the group.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On the request type configuration page, create a few request type groups
 # Add request types to a single group leaving the other request type groups empty
 # Go to the portal of the project

h3. Expected Results
The group containing the request types should appear on the portal.

h3. Actual Results
The request types are listed directly on the portal outside of the group

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Request type group does not appear on portal if only a single request type group exists

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A customer who does not have access to the project can still be selected as the reporter of a request in the project
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a customer in a project
 # Create a request in a different project (make sure the permission is set to "Customers my team adds to the project"). Once the request is created, set the reporter a the customer created in the first project

h3. Expected Results
The customer is not selectable as a reporter since not having access to the project
h3. Actual Results
The customer can be selected as the reporter

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Customer without permission to project can be added as a reporter of a request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the default setting, an extra character is added to the date selected by the date picker in customer portal

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # At Jira advanced settings(https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa), confirm that you are using the default setting for the two {{date.picker}} formats
 # Add a date picker field to the create issue screen and the request type
# Select a date in both the Jira create issue screen and the customer portal

h3. Expected Results
They both show the {{d/MMM/yy}} format. ex.29/11/19

h3. Actual Results
In the customer portal, it shows an extra character, ex. 29/11月/19
The Jira create issue screen shows the data as intended(29/11/19)

h3. Workaround
At Jira advanced settings(https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa), update {{jira.date.picker.javascript.format}} to {{%e/%m/%y}} (default is {{%e/%b/%y}})

h3. Note
Same applies to the date time picker field
fields.summary: New help center: date picker and date time picker formats not aligned with Jira settings when using a different language than Jira's default.

fields.description:
As there's no resolution in Jira Service Desk Next-gen projects, issues with the status Done still display at "My open issues" filter.

This feature request is to suggest that JSD Next-gen done issues stop being displayed at "My open issues" filter because several users who use the default "Issues and filters" to view their issues across multiple projects.
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk Next-gen issues with  "Done" status still appear in the default "My open issues" filter

fields.description: Kindly update us when there is a new upgrade/update on Jira Software and Service Desk. Please give a notification to us well in advance about UI changes or back groud functionality changes.
fields.summary: JIRA Software and Service Desk Cloud New version update

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, in the "Customer Permission" level, you can either set for public sign-up or privatized Service Desk which requires the Service Desk Agent to send invites in order for the customer to access the project. 

There is no in-between option and the customer permission works in either absolutes. 

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if there is an option to allow the creation of a private Service Desk which comes with the ability to set domain white-listing for a specific group of customers.

This allows the customer to send issues directly to the private Service Desk without the need of the Service Desk Agents to send invites. 

Any other customers who are not within the domain allowance won't be able to send emails to the private Service Desk.
fields.summary: Ability to set domain restriction for private Service Desk to allow self-sign up.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Opening an issue that contains SOAP - Envelope code snippets in the *Description* field from the portal view on IE11 will not be displayed correctly. The content overflows to the right of the portal screen obstructing the view of the fields there. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add SOAP - Envelope code snippets to the Description field of an issue.
# Go to IE11, open the issue from portal view.

h3. Expected Results
Description field content should be displayed correctly within the panel on the portal.

h3. Actual Results
Description field content is rendered incorrectly causing it to display outside the portal panel.

h3. Workaround
Place SOAP - Envelope code snippets into code block \{code} \{code}

h3. Note
Bug not reproducible on other browsers such as Chrome, Firefox.
fields.summary: Description field containing SOAP - Envelope code snippets breaks portal view on IE11

fields.description:
*Summary*

When performing the "Move" action from one issue type to another, the "Request Type" value stays the same, in reality when such a change is done, it should show "None". 

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a Service Desk ticket with a request type value
 !sample_1.PNG|thumbnail! 
# In the new issue view, Move to another issue type with a different request type value


*Expected Results*

The request type value is empty.
 !sample_2.PNG|thumbnail! 

*Actual Results*

The request type value has the same value as the previous issue type which is incorrect. If you change to "Old Issue View", it will show "No Match" for the request type, which is the expected outcome.


 !sample_3.PNG|thumbnail! 

*Effect*

From the  customer point of view, it is still visible and accessible despite having the wrong request type value. So the customer communication is still valid. 

*Workaround:*

Switch to old issue view to key in the value in the "Request Type" field.
fields.summary: Request Type shows incorrect value in New Issue View after performing Move action

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The workload default report has a pre-defined JQL that can't be changed. If the customer uses any other field to track the workload of the agents, it can't be changed.

h3. Suggested resolution

Bring the ability to edit the workload report JQL
fields.summary: Ability to edit the workload report filter JQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Portal layout is broken on IE 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Service Desk ticket
# Add a description summary by copying and pasting a value such as:
{noformat}
testeeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeeetesteeee
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
The description field should wrap the text layout.

h3. Actual Results
The layout is broken.
 !test.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Use another browser such as Chrome.
fields.summary: Portal layout is broken on IE 11

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The at *project customer permissions* documentation at https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/change-project-customer-permissions/ does not explain the configuration for Next-Gen projects.
h3. Suggested Solution
Include the Next-Gen projects "how-to" in the documentation as well
fields.summary: Improve the documentation on project customer permissions

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement

Currently, it is not possible to add descriptions and icons to request type groups. Without descriptions and icons, it is hard to differentiate between request types when there are many of them.
h3. Proposed solution

Ability to customize the description of request type groups instead of the default one showing the request type names:  !image-2019-11-22-16-32-07-636.png|thumbnail!
 Also, provide the ability to add icons to request type groups.
fields.summary: Ability to configure request type groups further

fields.description:
Our knowledge base on Confluence contains a matrix of articles and workflows that open links in new tabs when viewed via the service desk. The option to choose 'open link in new tab' and 'open link in same tab', or set up the links to operate a specific way when developing the articles in Confluence would assist our KB model. 

 

This closed ticket relates to this request.

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/How-to-make-links-from-a-Confluence-page-open-in-the-same-tab/qaq-p/897316]
fields.summary: Open link in same tab

fields.description: Would like to have the Request type as a selectable statistic type. To be able to organize a couple charts based on this information.
fields.summary: Add Request Type as Statistic Type for dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When replying or forwarding emails in the same thread to different email requests adds a comment to an existing issue instead of raising a new one
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send an email to an email request support@<domain>.atlassian.net
 # In the same thread, click on reply or forward to helpdesk@<domain>.atlassian.net

h3. Expected Results
The second email is to raise a new issue in the helpdesk project
h3. Actual Results
The second email adds a comment to the existing issue in support project

h3. Workaround
Start a new thread instead replying/forwarding emails in the same thread
fields.summary: Re: and Fwd: emails to different email requests adds a comment to an existing issue instead of raising a new one

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently when raising a new ticket on Jira Service Desk customer portal users can type keywords on the issue's summary and Jira will suggest *3 articles* based on these keywords.

This is also valid for searching articles within the "knowledge base" section of the Jira Service Desk Project - only displaying *3 suggested articles*

h3. Desired Results
Admins should be able to choose how many suggested articles would be displayed for their customers when typing the issue's summary, as well as how many results return from when searching from within the project itself.
fields.summary: Increase the number of suggested articles

fields.description:
Currently, the "Snap! You can't view this page" error simply states that a user must be a Service Desk Agent, but doesn't provide tips on how the issue could be quickly resolved. It is not always clear that the issue can be due to the *Role* a person has (and therefore the permissions they have).

It would be nice if the error suggested checking the following pages:
* People
* Permissions

This would help as it is more explicit in what to check instead of just implying the user doesn't have sufficient permissions.
fields.summary: "Snap! You can't view this page" should give tips on how to resolve the issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there's no option for the administrator to create the project component in a next-gen project. It's only available for Classic project.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the option to set the component.

 
h3. Workaround

Use classic project
fields.summary: Ability to create components for Next-Gen project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The issue in Customer Portal returns XML error when the attachment is missing. The attachment missing might due to migration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform JIRA migration without attachment
 # Once done, open issues at Customer Portal , for the issue that previously have attachment

h3. Expected Results
Issue loaded in Customer Portal
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
'No value present' XML return

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Issue doesn't load in Customer Portal when attachment missing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, *Organization* is not on the list for *Statistic Type* option.

h3. Suggested Solution

Insert *Organization* field in the list.

h3. Why this is important
Customer can monitor Issue Statistic based on *Organization*
fields.summary: Add "Organization" field on "Statistic Type" option for Pie Chart gadget

fields.description:
h2. Problem

When an agent goes to the portal to create a ticket on behalf of the customer, the Issue Created notification is sent with the "From" showing the agent who did this.
h2. !Screenshot 2019-11-18_15-26-59-127.png|width=378,height=197!
h2. Suggestion

Send the notification with the project's name the same as when a customer creates a ticket in the portal.

!Screenshot 2019-11-18_15-22-54-540.png|width=367,height=182!
fields.summary: Raising a request on behalf of the customer should generate a notification with the "From" from the project's name and not agent's name

fields.description:
h2. Problem

The ability to create sub-tasks were added to the new issue view for Jira Service Desk, but this is not true for SD next-gen.
h2. Suggestion

Add the ability to create sub-tasks the same as any other project.
fields.summary: Ability to create sub-tasks/child issues on team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when customer search from Customer Portal and there's no result , the page will only display as below :-
 !Screenshot 2019-11-18 at 8.21.09 PM.png|thumbnail! 
There's no options for customer to click a link and create issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a link , for example "Create a new issue" , and it will give options for customer to create issue from there.

h3. Why this is important
 Making options for customer to create issue from there , instead of going back to the portal request type list. It will make customer portal more user friendly.
 
h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Provide options to create new issue even when Customer Portal search return no result

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
URL encoding not working as expected at the new customer portal

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a folder in storage service such as Dropbox.
# Name this folder using a comma on its name: *Test, file*.
# Copy the URL to the description field in a Jira Service Desk ticket. Make sure you're in the old issue view.
# Access the portal and click on the link

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to access the link shared on the folder.

h3. Actual Results
The comma value is encoded as %252C% and the link to the folder is broken.

h3. Workaround
None available at this time.
fields.summary: URL encoding not working as expected at the new customer portal and new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When editing the fields on a request type in Classic projects, you can set a default value (this default value is mandatory if you are hiding the field from the portal).

 !image-2019-11-15-11-37-49-554.png|thumbnail! 

If you search for and add a user that has a different username and userkey in the app_user table in the database, then that user cannot be added as an approver and it will show an error to say "Could not find usernames: <user-key>".

 !image-2019-11-15-11-37-33-831.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a classic Service Desk project (e.g.  using the Internal Service Desk project template)
# Invite an agent to the project (or any user who can be added as an approver).
# Go to the app_user table in the database and update the "user_key" column for the agent to something other than their "lower_user_name". (e.g. UPDATE app_user SET user_key="not-user-name" where lower_user_name="user-name") - Note: For historical reasons some customers naturally end up in this state. It's not necessarily the case that their database was manually updated. It may have happened on import, or some other reason. This is just a simple way to reproduce the issue for testing.
# Go to project settings > request types and edit the fields on the "Travel Request" request type (any request type with an approver field will do)
# Hide the field from the customer portal. This will pop up a dialog to set the default approver.
# Search for the user you added in Step 2 and try to set them as the approver.

h3. Expected Results
The user is added as the default approver.

h3. Actual Results
An error is displayed "Could not find usernames: not-user-name"

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: User cannot be added as default approver on customer portal request for specific users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Multiple attachments instances created 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket at the customer portal
# Within Jira(old issue view) add an attachment that is not visible at the customer portal
# Go to the customer portal and drag-and-drop that same file
 
h3. Expected Results
You should have a single file uploaded.

h3. Actual Results
Multiple instances of the same attachment are added.

!attachment.gif|width=500!

h3. Notes
Tested on Chrome and Safari.

h3. Workaround
Instead of using drag and drop use the "browse" feature to look for your file at customer portal.
fields.summary: Multiple attachments instances created

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a comment is added with a smart link (e.g. Dropbox or Google Drive) from the JSD customer portal, the link cannot be viewed in the comment on the old issue view in the agent view in Jira.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the JSD customer portal
# Add a comment with a dropbox link
# Go to the Jira issue view for this issue.

h3. Expected Results
The dropbox link renders and can be seen by the agent in the comment.

h3. Actual Results
The comment doesn't show the link at all.

Editing the comment, it is possible to see that the comment contents are not converted from ADF into Wiki Markup.

h3. Workaround
View the request in the customer portal request details view.
fields.summary: Comments created in the customer portal with a smart link (Dropbox, Google Drive, etc.) cannot be seen in the old issue view in Jira

fields.description:
When you have the configuration to enable customers to create their own accounts on the JSD project, the customers can use the Sign-up option, which will trigger the following email to complete the process:

"Almost done!

Follow the link below to finish signing up to Test Service Desk. For security, don't share this link with anyone."

This feature request is to allow the customisation of this notification because it would be great to have the ability to edit all of the other customer notifications, to use a similar "tone" and "voice" to that which is used on others customer notifications, and to be able to "brand" the email, to include logo, etc.
fields.summary: Customize customer Sign up notification

fields.description:
h2. Problem

When a company has many projects and need to use a custom queue, they need to create one by one for each project.
h2. Suggestion

Add a drop-down to select a custom queue from other project, so it won't be necessary to add the JQL and select the fields on every project we need to use the queue, or add a list containing all SD projects when creating a custom queue to select the project we also need to use the same queue.
fields.summary: Ability to inherit queues from other projects when creating a custom queue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Project still appears in the portal even if all request types are hidden or deleted.

This option is important in case the administrator wants customers to use only the email channel since currently, we can't disable the customer portal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Service Desk project.
 # Click on Request types.
 ## If it's a next-gen project, delete the request types.
 ## If it's a classic, you can remove the request types from the groups.

h3. Expected Results

It will show "You don't have access to any portals"
h3. Actual Results

The project is still visible on the portal for the customer to click on it.
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Project still appears in the portal even if all request types are hidden

fields.description:
Creating sub-task in Service Desk project is not possible

h3. Issue Summary
Creating a sub-task from a Service Desk issue is currently not possible. The create form would not select the Sub-task issue type although it is available for the project
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Service Desk issue, click (...) then _Create sub-task_
 # Fill in the ticket details and click Create

h3. Expected Results
Sub-task is created
h3. Actual Results
Sub-task is not created

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Notes
The sub-task issue task does not appear in the create form
fields.summary: Creating sub-task in Service Desk project is not possible

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira webhooks for "user_updated" and "user_deleted" events don't fire if a JSD customer account user is updated or deleted in user management.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD customer account, such as in a JSD project: go to *Customers > Add customers* and add a new customer
 # Create a webhook in Jira global administration, listening to all the user related events (created, updated, deleted). You can use a tool like "request catcher" to show the requests that come through.
 # Go to *settings* > *user management* (site administration) > *Jira Service Desk*
 # Edit the full name of a customer

h3. Expected Results

A "user_updated" webhook event is published.
h3. Actual Results

No event is published for the updated user.
h3. Workaround
Periodically re-fetch customer information using the JSD Cloud REST API.
fields.summary: Updating or deleting a customer account does not send "user_updated" or "user_deleted" webhooks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have a particularly long organisation name, it is not possible to see the full length of it in the issue view. This presents a problem if you have multiple organisation names that start with the same set of characters, as it can become impossible to differentiate between them in the dropdown menu.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the issue view
 # Open the list of organisations from the organisations field

h3. Expected Results

If a organisation has a very long name, we should be able to see the full name of the organisation if we hover over one of the options in the dropdown.
h3. Actual Results

The dropdown cuts off with "..." if it is too long.
h3. Workaround

There is currently no known workaround.
fields.summary: Long organisation names are cut off on the issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Next-gen Service Desk projects which are set to private are not restricted and is accessible to all customers on the site
h3. Environment
* Next-gen Service Desk
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the a Next-gen Service Desk project Access to Private
# Access the portal without being added as a customer to the project

h3. Expected Results
The project would not be listed in the portal
h3. Actual Results
The project is visible and appears not restricted
 
h3. Workaround
Migrate to a Classic project where you may apply customer permissions to restrict the project
fields.summary: Configuring Next-gen Service Desk projects to private does not restrict the portal to customers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Not able to upload files at customer portal on IE 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a ticket in the customer portal using IE 11
# Try to upload a file (either by drag and drop, browse...)

h3. Expected Results
Users are able to upload the file

h3. Actual Results
They receive an error saying:
* Failed to load

h3. Notes
If you try to upload the file during the creation time the following error is thrown on UI:
{noformat}
Failed to load
{noformat}

!attach.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Use another browser such as Chrome, Safari, Edge, Firefox.
fields.summary: Not able to upload files at customer portal on IE 11

fields.description:
Hi,

 

Do you have any addons that can enable SMS notifications for JSD cloud setup triggered by SLA breach/about to breach.
fields.summary: SMS notification for JIRA Service Desk (Std)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the issue REST API (/rest/api/3/issue/\{issueIdOrKey}), the name for the "issuetype" field is returned as "Issue Type" for next-gen JSD projects when it should be "Request Type". In our native apps, we display the field name in our Issue screen and showing an "Issue Type" can be confusing/misleading.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Find or create an issue in a next-gen JSD project
 # Fetch the issue via the issue REST API (/rest/api/3/issue/\{issueIdOrKey})
 # Inspect the JSON

h3. Expected Results

The name for the "issuetype" field is "Request Type"
h3. Actual Results

The name for the "issuetype" field is "Issue Type"
{noformat}
"editmeta": {
    "fields": {
[...]
      "issuetype": {
        "required": false,
        "schema": {
          "type": "issuetype",
          "system": "issuetype"
        },
        "name": "Issue Type",
        "key": "issuetype",
[...]{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround

We could rename the field name client-side but that would require the same change in all clients and can lead to localisation mismatches.
fields.summary: Name for "issuetype" field is returned as "Issue Type" instead of "Request Type" in REST API for next-gen JSD projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using Internet Explorer from Citrix or virtual box, Attachments fail to load on the new customer portal design

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an attachment to one of the tickets that has a valid request type
# View the portal link in Internet explorer 

h3. Expected Results
The attachments load fine

h3. Actual Results
The attachments are not loaded and report an error *Failed to load* 
 !IE.png|thumbnail! 

It loads fine in another browser like chrome and firefox:
 !firefox.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Use another [supported browsers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/supported-browsers-744721663.html] like Chrome and Mozilla firefox
fields.summary: When using Internet Explorer from Citrix or virtual box, Attachments fail to load on the new customer portal design

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The new customer portal re-design as detailed in the update blog: [Atlassian Cloud changes Oct 28 to Nov 4, 2019 \-|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2019/11/atlassian-cloud-changes-oct-28-to-nov-4-2019#AtlassianCloudchangesOct28toNov4,2019-jira.service.desk] has changed the order of the comments from oldest on the bottom and newest on top to the other way around with the newest comments being on the bottom.

This is to align more with the [The new Jira issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html]

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a portal configuration option to determine the order of how the updates to a ticket appear, either newest on the top or newest on the bottom.
fields.summary: Make the comment/update order configurable in request view of the customer portal

fields.description: For EU legislation reasons (GDPR), our organisation (and probably many many more organisations) has to be able to permanently remove personal data (patiënt healthcare information) from Jira Servicedesk issues that were accidentally registered (by customers). We can now only alter the data, the effect being that the discription does not contain the personal data anymore, but the personal data remains in the history of the issue. So it would be nice to have a GUI option to delete the personal dat from the history as well, without a DB administrator doing the job.
fields.summary: GUI possibility to permanently remove data from issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When *user_key* and *lower_user_name* do not match, user can not be added as *Assignee* in the *Edit fields* page of a *Request type*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Locate a user whose *user_key* and *lower_user_name* do not match
 # Try to add them as the *Assignee* in the *Edit fields* page of a *Request type*

h3. Expected Results
The user is set as the *Assignee* default for the *Request type*
h3. Actual Results
Receive the following error:
{quote}
User ... does not exist.
{quote}

h3. Workaround

The *user_key* and *lower_user_name* values should be made to be the same.
fields.summary: When user_key and lower_user_name do not match, user can not be added as Assignee

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to drag and drop transitions to To-do and In-progress status and not able to drag and drop/create transitions to Done status.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Jira Service Desk project settings > Request types > Edit Workflow;
# Create/add a Done status on your workflow;
# Try to drag and drop/add a transition to the status created/added above;
# Provide the transition name and hit *Create*.

h3. Expected Results
The transition is created successfully.

h3. Actual Results

At console the following error is being thrown:
{noformat}
react-dom.production.min.js:187 TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
    at e.value (view.js:72)
{noformat}

Error on UI:
!ui_error.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Instead of drag and drop, add the transition by clicking on the top menu *Transition*. It only works for *To-do* and *In-progress* status.
!workaround.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
The above workaround does not work for *Done* statuses.
fields.summary: Not able to drag and drop/create a new workflow transition

fields.description:
Problem Definition
 It currently is not possible to delete or edit default reports shown in the sidebar in Jira Service Desk.
 !スクリーンショット 2019-11-05 11.45.46.png|width=503,height=305!

 

Suggested Solution
 It would be nice if the default reports can be delete or edit like custom reports.
 This would allow for customers to find report easier.
fields.summary: Ability to delete/edit default reports shown in the sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customers are missing from Customers list.
 As a result, agents cannot pick customers from user pickers.

Scenarios:
 - JSD customers are randomly dropped from JSD project where the setting allows anyone to access project
 - JSD customers are randomly dropped from JSD project where setting allows to only manually add JSD customers
 -  A site-admin added a customer in the service desk project. But after refreshing the page, the customer is no longer there and not searchable.
 - Customers are disappearing from JSD organization when checking one example customer in user management > jira service desk, it seems that the customer becomes inactive. You would access customers via https://<instancename>/projects/<projectkey>/customers

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Jira service desk customers page
 # Search for existing customer that is impacted

h3. Expected Results

Agents are able to see the customer in the list
h3. Actual Results

Agents are unable to see customers , as they are not in the list
h3. Workaround

If assistance is required urgently , please contact support. We expect the issue to be resolved within 24 hours of the creation of this ticket.
fields.summary: Users missing from Customers listings in some JSD instances

fields.description: For some requests via portal, it would be useful to have fields on a single line. For example, having a layout where a source IP, source port, destination IP, and destination port are all on the same line.
fields.summary: Ability to have some custom fields on a single line in portal

fields.description:
Currently, the customer portal shows a button that shows the current status of the notification for an issue key, and the same button can be used to turn it back on 

For example, it says *Notifications off* when the customer has turned off the notifications for an issue and if you click on the *Notification off* button, it will turn on the notifications for the same issue:
 !image.png|thumbnail! 

It can be confusing for a few customers thinking that when *Notifications off* button is available, it means that notifications are currently on for the issue and they can click on *Notifications off* to actually turn it off 

h3. Suggestion:
Change the *Notification off* label to something more descriptive so that customers do not get confused and know exactly what the button does
fields.summary: More information about the Notification button available on customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing the queue from other pages, by default it will display the *Open Issues* queue although this queue was never configured.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Customers
 # Click on Queue to open the queue page

h3. Expected Results
The top most queue is displayed

h3. Actual Results
https://<domain>/projects/<projectID>/queues/default is displayed

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accessing queue by default opens an unconfigured queue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer notifications about tickets are going directly to SPAM.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk ticket and make sure it has a request type on it;
# Comment for customer on the ticket;
# Check the SPAM inbox of the mailbox.

h3. Expected Results

The customer notifications arrive at the inbox.

h3. Actual Results

Customer notifications are going directly to the SPAM inbox.

h3. Workaround

Whitelist all the Atlassian Domains and IPs in this doc: [Atlassian Cloud IP ranges and domains|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html].
fields.summary: Service Desk customer notifications are being marked as SPAM

fields.description:
Hi all, we need add a option to sort comments on customer portal. 

it is possible?

 

Thanks
fields.summary: Add option to sort comment.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* The *Invite team* functionality seems broken. It throws an error *Something went wrong. Check your connection, then give it another try.* when clicked.
 !Screenshot 2019-10-31 at 7.36.19 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In any service desk project, click *Invite team*

h3. Expected Results
* A popup to invite agents appears:
 !Screenshot 2019-10-31 at 7.38.39 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* An error is thrown:
 !Screenshot 2019-10-31 at 7.36.19 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in console:
{noformat}
{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"Project was not found"}],"reasonKey":"sd.admin.servicedesk.error.missingproject","reasonCode":"404"}
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Add the users from *Project Settings*->*People* section to the *Service Desk Team* role.
fields.summary: Invite Team throws an error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no option for the administrator to set the project email address at next gen project. It's only available for Classic project.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option to set the notification email.

h3. Why this is important
Adminstrator want the customer to receive notification from their own custom email , instead of jira@xxx.atlassian.net
h3. Workaround 
Use classic project
fields.summary: Ability to set custom email for the project notification email for Next Gen project

fields.description:
It would be nice if articles with labels were able to be placed into specific categories of a a JSD project automatically.

For example, if I create a Confluence article with the label *test-label*, I could then go configure a category within my JSD project to automatically add articles with that label to that category and all articles currently with that label or that have that label added in the future would automatically be placed in that category.
fields.summary: Automatically add knowledge base articles to categories based on label

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
At the moment, JIRA Service Desk has the feature to share the comment to the customer or internally. But, in case that the comment was shared to the customer before and changed to internally after that, it is already triggered a notification to the recipient. At the time when they access the request from the portal, there will be no comment as it switched to internal. This makes confusion.

*Suggested Solution*
To have at least the switch-a-roo to be recorded in the Issue History hence, at least the agents or admins understand why the notification is sent out before.
fields.summary: Public and Internal Comment switch to be recorded in Issue History

fields.description:
When you change the issue type of a service desk ticket and don't select a new request type all attachments in this ticket fail to load in the portal view.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create an issue through the customer portal and attach an image;
 !print.png|width=236,height=185!
 # Change its issue type but don't select a new request type;
 # Open the issue in the customer portal.

h3. Expected results

You can still see the attachment.
h3. Actual result

Attachment fails to load
 !print2.png|width=269,height=189!
h3. Notes

In the new issue view the original request type still appears after changing the issue type (JRACLOUD-73078) make sure to select a request type compatible with the current issue type.
h3. Workaround

Select a request type compatible with the new issue type.
fields.summary: Attachments fail to load on customer portal when Request Type is empty

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a username was renamed, their user cannot be selected as the preset user in Request Type configuration
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Request Type with approvals configuration
 # Add the approver to Request Type
 # Set the field as hidden to select a preset value
 # Select the renamed user

h3. Expected Results
User is selected as the preset user for approver
h3. Actual Results
Error: Could not find usernames is displayed


h3. Workaround
Contact the Atlassian Support to have the username fixed.
fields.summary: Renamed users cannot be selected as preset user in Request Type configuration

fields.description: It would be nice to have the possibility to search by fields and custom fields in queues (with selectbox or text search)
fields.summary: Search filter

fields.description: It would be nice to have the possibility to edit issues inline directly when using queues
fields.summary: Inline edit issues in queue

fields.description: It would be great to have the possibility to drag and drop issues in queues to order issues in particular queue
fields.summary: Drag and drop issues in queues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Customers do not receive notifications when they are added to "Share (Request participant)" in the service desk portal.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a service desk issue
# View the issue from the portal.
# Share the issue with a customer

h3. Expected Results
A notification that they've been added as a participant to the ticket is sent to the customer

h3. Actual Results
No notification is sent to the customer

h3. Workaround
Currently none
fields.summary: No notification sent when customer share issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When two connect addons are installed in the "Request create property panel" as per documentations ([https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/request-create-property-panel/]). If one app fails to call `validate()` or `serialize()` then no app data is sent from either addon. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install 2 connect addons in "Request create property panel"
 # Ensure addon doesn't call the `serialize()` callback
 # Submit a request with both addons data filled out
 # The new request wont have any data on it provided by the addons

h3. Expected Results

The data for the addon that doesn't call `serialize()`  should not be recorded. All other compliant addons data should be recorded on the new request.
h3. Actual Results

Data from all addons are not added the the request. Only fields that are part of the  default form are saved to the newly created request.
h3. Workaround

If you are a developer of the connect addon ensure that `validate()` and `serialize()` are both called even if no action is taken on the panel. See documentation for more details [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/request-create-property-panel/]

If you are an admin uninstall or disable the addon that is causing the issue. This is most likely a recently installed addon.
fields.summary: Request create property panel - one app blocks another app's data serialization

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Moving an issue from a project to another project means customers in the portal cannot comment on the issue until its request type is fixed

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go into agent view and move an issue to a classic project
 # User comments on the issue on the portal
 # They get an error when commenting

h3. Expected Results

The customer should be able to comment in the portal.
h3. Actual Results

They cannot comment.
h3. Workaround

Add a type to the issue and the customer can now comment in the portal.
fields.summary: Moving an issue from a project to another project means customers in the portal cannot comment on the issue until its type is fixed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, add attachment button is not available on JSM new issue view. The button is available for issues on JSW projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any new issue view for the JSM project
 # Look for the attachment button

 * !Screenshot 2021-05-06 at 9.46.56 PM.png|thumbnail! (JSM Project)
 * !Screenshot 2021-05-06 at 6.59.54 PM.png|thumbnail! (JSW Project)

h3. Expected Results

Attachment button visible
h3. Actual Results

Attachment button not visible.
h3. Suggestions:

Show Attachment button on JSM issues.
h3. Workaround

Add attachment from the comment field. If the attachment need to be restricted, add internal comment.
fields.summary: Attachment button is not displayed at JIRA Service Desk new issue view

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update|titleBGColor=#d23f3f|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#d23f3f|bgColor=#F8F8F8|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
It is only possible to define the default language while creating the project. There are no plans to support changing the default language after the project has been created.
 !image-2020-04-23-20-58-29-150.png|thumbnail! 
{panel}

h3. Original Description
Jira Service Desk next-gen project currently does not allow changing the project default language. 

Many customers based their project default language on the region they support hence would require different default languages for different projects.
fields.summary: Ability to change the default language

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Allow to Lock Portal Only User account after multiple Incorrect Password Attempts
fields.summary: Allow to Lock Portal Only User account after multiple Incorrect Password Attempts

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Notify Portal Only User when Password Changed by Admins
fields.summary: Notify Portal Only User when Password Changed by Admins

fields.description: As a help seeker, I do not want to see/get an update everytime my ticket changes status if the status is not relevant to me (e.g. if ticket goes through multiple internal steps (like 'escalated to L2' or 'awaiting external vendor response'), it still shows 'waiting for support' to the help seeker and no update/notification is sent to the help seeker.
fields.summary: Ability to alias workflow status for help seekers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attaching an image via copy pasting into the comment box on the issue view, sometimes the "Attach Screenshot" modal fails to appear, and instead the image is automatically uploaded. We have not been able to narrow down why this occurs, and it occurs randomly.
h3. Why this is a problem

 

The user loses the ability to double-check this is the image they want to upload, and to choose the image name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View an issue, either from queues or /browse
 # Paste in an image into the comment box using CMD+V or Ctrl+V
 # The "Attach Screenshot" modal may fail to display, and instead the image is uploaded straight away.

h3. Expected Results

The modal should always display before uploading the image.
fields.summary: Attaching images in the issue view does not always bring up the attachments modal

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When an issue is moved between projects, the request type is lost and the request type can't be edited while moving the ticket. This causes problems with communication with customers.

h3. Suggested resolution

Add the "Issue Moved" trigger in the automation rules.
fields.summary: Add "Issue Moved" in automation rule triggers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the customer permission "Who can customers share requests with?" is set to "Any customer in the project, by manually entering an email address", the user is not found in user picker fields when entering the entire email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the customer permission "Who can customers share requests with?" to "Any customer in the project, by manually entering an email address";
# Access the request type that has a user picker field added with a customer account;
# Add the entire email of a user in the user picker field.

h3. Expected Results

When the entire email is added, the user is found by the system and added to the field.

h3. Actual Results

The user seems to not be found by the system and the email is being added as a new customer.
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-28 at 13.03.12.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Even the message seems to be adding a new customer, the correct user is added to the user picker field.
fields.summary: User seems to not be found when entering the entire email in user picker fields in the portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Manually sorting a jsd queue greys out any avatars in the table
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a JSD queue, e.g. <instance>.atlassian.net/projects/<projectKey>/queues/custom/<queueID>
 # Manually sort by a field

h3. Expected Results

The avatars in the table will appear the same
h3. Actual Results

The avatars are greyed out

!image-2019-10-28-17-46-06-816.png|width=775,height=178!
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page.
fields.summary: Manually sorting a jsd queue greys out any avatars in the table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Manually sorting by a field for a queue does not persist the sorting across page loads
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a JSD queue using the new URL, e.g. <instance>.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/<projectKey>/queues/custom/<queueID>
 # Manually sort by a field by clicking on it in the header of the table.
 # Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

The table will still be sorted by the field
h3. Actual Results

The table has reverted to the default sort order.
h3. Workaround

Load the queue by the old url, e.g. <instance>.atlassian.net/projects/<projectKey>/queues/custom/<queueID>
fields.summary: Manually sorting by a field for a queue does not persist the sorting across page loads

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The create issue in automation rules does not allow the mapping of custom fields which makes it tedious to manually copy the required fields to the destination issue.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the Ability to map custom field when creating issues via automation
h3. Workaround 
Use Jira Misc Workflow Extensions (add-on) to copy the value from linked issue
fields.summary: Ability to map custom field when creating issues via automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing an average SLA report, it shows a value for the average but when looking at the ticket itself, the value is different. There is a discrepancy between ticket SLA information and average SLA reports.

h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk reports.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an SLA with a calendar goal.
# Create an SLA report of SLA average.
# Leave the ticket run the SLA and also create and issue where the SLA is not applied.
# Check the SLA report.

h3. Expected Results

The ticket SLA information and the report should exactly match.

h3. Actual Results

The ticket shows 2m elapsed from a 10m SLA.
  !Screen Shot 2019-10-24 at 12.18.38.png|thumbnail! 

The report shows two information:
1. Elapsed 1m for the same ticket:
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-24 at 12.18.18.png|thumbnail! 

2. Elapsed 1.82m for the same ticket, which is 1m + 82% of 60s = 1.49m
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-24 at 12.21.02.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Discrepancy between ticket SLA information and average SLA reports
When trying to use the Create Linked Issue in a Jira Software Board, nothing happens

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sometimes, SLA does not stop when an agent is assigned to the ticket by automation rules triggered upon ticket creation
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule to assign issues as soon as the issue is created
 !automation.png|thumbnail!
 # Create an SLA *Time to assign* that starts when an issue is unassigned and which stops when the issue has the assignee field set to a user:
 !SLA.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

When the issue is created and assigned to a user from the automation rule, the SLA *Time to assign* is met
h3. Actual Results

When the issue is created and assigned to a user from the automation rule, the SLA *Time to assign* is met and you can see the same information in the SLA audit log, however, the same information is not reflected in the ticket. The SLA clock keeps running and eventually breaches.
 If you apply the kb [Missing or corrupted SLA data in Jira Service Desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/missing-or-corrupted-sla-data-in-jira-service-desk-828790603.html] the issue starts showing the correct SLA information.
h3. Workaround
* Apply the kb [Missing or corrupted SLA data in Jira Service Desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/missing-or-corrupted-sla-data-in-jira-service-desk-828790603.html] the issue starts showing the correct SLA information

* We have another workaround using a free add-on [Project Automation for JIRA Cloud - lite|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215670/automation-for-jira-cloud-lite?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] available in the marketplace that can help us to get around this by setting it up like this:
!workaround.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Sometimes SLA does not stop when an agent is assigned to the ticket by automation rules triggered upon ticket creation

fields.description:
When we have the JSD project integrated with add-ons like proforma etc, the fields of these add-ons are visible on the Desktop browser however not on the app that causes users to revert to the Desktop for their work.

This causes inconvenience.

Jira App should be able to parse the whole request exactly as it is visible on the browser.
fields.summary: Jira Mobile App- Add-on fields are not visible

fields.description:
h3. Problem

It isn't possible to select a status from and to using the automation status changed trigger.

h3. Suggested resolution

Create the ability to select a from/to status on automation trigger.
fields.summary: Add from/to on status changed automation trigger

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, when a customer using Firefox browser and try to paste text during issue creation at Customer Portal , the text disappears. It happens when customer open the request form after viewing on any issue at customer portal.
h3. Environment
Firefox browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Customer Portal using Firefox browser
 # View any issue from the my request page.
# Then, click the portal name at the breadcrumbs link at the top of view issue screen.
# Then, open the request form.
# Try to paste any text to "Summary" or "Description" field

h3. Expected Results
Able to paste the text.

h3. Actual Results
The text disappear.

h3. Notes
Chrome works as expected.

h3. Workaround
# Use a different browser , for example Chrome.
# Key in the text instead of pasting it.
fields.summary: Unable to paste text to any field when creating issue at Customer Portal (Firefox browser)

fields.description:
If fields are created with duplicated names in Next-gen projects, some errors will start showing in your project settings. I could reproduce this behavior with the *Issue Type* field, but it's possible that other field names also cause this bug.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a service desk (Next-gen) project of any template;
 # Go to Project settings > Request types;
 # Create a field (of any type) with the name *Issue Type*;
 # Click on 'Add request type' (left sidebar) > Enter a name and hit Create;
 # Observe the error below. If you click 'Cancel' and refresh the page you will see that your new request type was actually created
 !print.png|thumbnail!
 # Try to access any other request type and click on 'Edit workflow'. The following error will be displayed.
!print3.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

All request types added after the creation of the *Issue Type* field will be created with no fields added.
!print2.png|thumbnail!

Deleting the new request type will make all workflows accessible again, but if a new request type is created, the error will reappear.
h3. Workaround

Rename the 'Issue Type' field to something else.
fields.summary: Creating a field with duplicated name in Next-gen project makes workflows inaccessible

fields.description:
Hello, 

Working in a distributed engineering team alongside our customer support team, it can be challenging to plan changes and maintenance. 

Specifically, our customers request updates in their local timezone, which is different from the timezone of the customer support and of the engineer who will take charge of the ticket.

This is why it would be great for Jira to handle timezone in a better way than not showing anything and assuming that the time is in the local timezone.

Jira should display the timezone of the field in one way or another:
 * By hovering on the date field
 * By displaying it alongside the date
 * By allowing to change its format (using the abbreviation (e.g. CET/CEST), the full name (Europe/Paris) or the offset from UTC (+0200)).

Another neat functionality would be to have absolute time fields allowing to pick the date, time and timezone. This would be the same value displayed for all users and include the timezone, date & time. A neat addition would be to display the local date / time based on browser when hovering over this field. 

 

My team work in 4 different timezones, 3 of them observing DST and all change at a different date so mistakes are very easily made converting dates back and forth. (e.g. California, Central Europe, India and Eastern Australia).

 

Thank you

Thomas
fields.summary: Provide timezone context with date and time fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, assets item are limited to 10000 items from JIRA end. There's no options to increase the value.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide options to increase the limit

h3. Why this is important
Some organization has more than 10000 items at their end. 

h3. Workaround 
Even if not ideal, there is an option to bucket the assets into multiple different asset types.
The 10000 items limit applies to the {{GET /rest/assetapi/asset}} REST API endpoint (documented here: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/assetsapi/rest/api-group-assets/#api-asset-get), so when filtering by asset types it is possible to have 10000 assets per asset type.
fields.summary: Ability to extend asset limit beyond 10000

fields.description:
Feature request to have a SLA state change to be used in automation rules

 
----
_Note for customers who have been contacted by email regarding upcoming SLA changes potentially impacting their automation rules:_

Due to legal/privacy requirements, Atlassian cannot review how you have configured your automation rules (as it's user generated content) and confirm whether there will be any impact to you with the upcoming SLA changes. 

Our current assumption is that a feature request for a SLA state change might be the best solution for automation rules using SLA values. However without more information about your use case / setup, we cannot be sure 100%.

Our recommendation is to either
 # share how you have configured the automation rules with SLA values (ideal solution if this is appropriate for you)
 # alternatively share how you are using the rules conceptually (if you cannot share the actual JQL/user generated content)
 # or contact Support or Christophe Capel (reporter on this ticket) with more information

Thanks

The Jira Service Desk team

 

P-S: To prevent SPAM, attachments have been turned off on this instance, so if you want to include attachments, please include links to Dropbox, etc. instead. Thanks
fields.summary: SLA state change event

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As the admin, we wish to have the ability to bulk updating the status of a customer account (portal only account)

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide the ability to bulk activate/deactivate the portal only accounts on User Management
* Provide the REST API to activate/deactivate the customer accounts as per [JSDCLOUD-8533|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-8533]

h3. Why this is important
* In some scenarios, the client no longer eligible to raise a support ticket or access the company's portal. Thus, we would like to deactivate all the accounts from the client.
* When they got the eligibility, we would need to bulk activating their accounts again.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk activate/deactivate the customer accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue

Changing the SLA configuration leaves the SLA in an inconsistent state. Showing that SLA recalculation is in progress forever.
h3. Environment
 * JSD Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Only reproducible for the projects created between 29th August and September 10.
 * Change the SLA configuration. For example, change Start, Stop or Pause condition or change the Goal settings. Basically, any change in SLA configuration triggers a recalculation.
 * Save it.

h3. Expected Results
 * SLA recalculation is done successfully and SLA metrics are updated and showing in the queue and issue view.

h3. Actual Results
 * SLA recalculation is never finished and SLA metrics are not updated and not showing in the queue and issue view.

h3. Notes
 * None

h3. Workaround
 * Use this article [Missing or corrupted SLA data in Jira Service Desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/missing-or-corrupted-sla-data-in-jira-service-desk-828790603.html] to temporarily fix the issue, or
 * Re-create the affected SLA configurations.  There was a bug in the code between 29th August and September 10 that left any SLA configurations created in a partially corrupted state.  Re-creating the SLA configuration will fix the issue.  i.e. Delete and create a new SLA configuration, an update to an existing configuration is not enough.
fields.summary: Changing the SLA configuration leaves the SLA in an inconsistent state

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a single user picker field, and add an Atlassian Account as default value
 # Completely remove the Atlassian Account from the instance on the User Management area.
 # Create a new issue on any project/issue type/workflow

h3. Expected Results
 * Create the issue normally

h3. Actual Results
 * All attempts to create a new issue (regardless of project, issue type/workflow) will fail with the error: "<Custom Field Name>: User '<AA>' is not valid for this user picker."

h3. Workaround

CHange the default user for the custom field.
fields.summary: Deleting the Atlassian Account used as default user for single user picker field used on an approver step breaks all create issue operations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Old value under Approver field disappears while editing this Field under Request type.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
Goto Project Settings > Request Type
Edit Fields and add the Field Approver and hide it with a Preset value
Now Edit the field Approver to add another value.
We see that the Older value disappears:



h3. Expected Results

The older value should be retained
h3. Actual Results

The older value disappears causing confusions

h3. Notes

While creating a request, the old value of the field approvers is retained hence this works fine. The issue is only while editing the field under request types.

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Approver field's value is lost from under Request Type

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Help Center fallback background flickering

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on Jira Icon(top left corner)  > Jira settings > Products > Jira Service Desk > Configuration
# In the Help Center section, click *View and customize*.
# Set a background image.

h3. Expected Results
Once the help center page is loaded we should see the background.

h3. Actual Results
Before the image is fully loaded the background color is shown.
 
h3. Notes
The issue can be noticed on the following gif.
 !helpCenter.gif|width=300!
 
h3. Workaround
No workaround available at this time.
fields.summary: Help Center fallback background flickering on page load

fields.description: We have a requirement to hide some of the category/sub category on JSD portal based on the user location or any other criteria.  Also, on form load  on portal there should be a way to make a web api call populate to some of the form fields.
fields.summary: Hide some of the category/sub category on JSD portal based on the user location

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The satisfaction rating is sent together with the Request Resolved notification. This puts the ratings below a long notification which customer might miss and not provide the rating.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to move the satisfaction rating before the Request Resolved for more clarity.
fields.summary: Ability to move the satisfaction rating to the top of the notification
REST API /rest/api/3/group/user responses internal server error when portal-only user is specified

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

Currently, if the portal has many KB categories, the categories list is very long and the option to *raise a request* goes off the page so customers can't see that without scrolling. This causes confusion to the customer and is not visually user friendly. 
 * One cause of this is having a lot of whitespace between of the categories. 
 * Secondly, the categories are listed in a single long row.  This is not making good use of the available space on the portal. 

h3. Proposed Solution

Improve the appearance of the KB categories by,
 # Reducing the whitespace of the categories so the can be listed more compactly and reduce space on screen.
 # Allow the use of columns instead of a sinle row so that the category list is shortened.
fields.summary: Improve the appearance of KB categories on portal view

fields.description: I have created new document in Confluence and attached a video. I can display embedded video within Confluence but when I open the document in Service desk, there is just a link, I need video that I can play the same way like in Confluence.  I cannot use [Widget Connector Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/widget-connector-macro-724765314.html] because it is meant for external URIs like Youtube.
fields.summary: Service desk does not display embedded video

fields.description:
Our customers have requested the ability to sort comments in the customer portal request view by newest to oldest, or vice versa. Having to scroll down through a large number of comments, rather than having the most recent comment at the top as it used to be, has been described as highly inconvenient.

Thanks
fields.summary: Option to sort comments in portal by newest to oldest

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The table created in the Issue comment is not rightly displayed in the portal.
The Outline of the table, and the table Structure is distorted. Screenshots below
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!   !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Affects both new issue view and old issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
As an Agent create a table in the Comment of Description of the issue.
Share the comment with the customer.
View the comment in the portal.

h3. Expected Results
The table structure should be intact and should be visible as is in the portal.

h3. Actual Results
The table Structure is distorted and does not have the outline
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Table created in the Issue comment are not rightly displayed in the portal
